The Village

The Village: A Historic School Building Reimagined

Exceptional Venue
| Award Winning|Tulse Hill, London SW2 3UP

About The Old School

The Old School Workspace is a historic Grade II listed school building thoughtfully converted into versatile venue spaces while preserving its original character and charm, from intimate meeting rooms to large halls.

Each space, from private offices to large event halls, highlights original features while incorporating modern amenities and technology. Perfect for focused work, collaborative projects, corporate events, community gatherings, or private celebrations.

Our dedicated team ensures your event runs smoothly, with support from initial inquiry through to the day of your event.

The Old School Workspace

A historic building reimagined for modern events and gatherings

A Versatile Venue for Every Occasion

Our historic school building has been reimagined as a modern, flexible workspace with character and charm. From corporate events to sports activities, we offer a range of spaces to suit your needs.

Sports Hall

Sports Hall

A spacious multi-purpose hall suitable for various events and sports activities.A spacious multi-purpose hall suitable for various events and sports activities. With high ceilings and excellent natural light, this versatile space can be configured to suit a wide range of needs.

Capacity:

  • Seated at round tables: 192 (24 tables, 8 per table)
  • Standing capacity: At least 800

Dimensions:

18m x 32.9m (592.2 sqm / 6,374 sq ft)

Features:

  • High ceilings
  • Excellent natural light
  • Football capacity: 6-a-side
  • Versatile configuration options
  • Our largest venue space
  • Multiple basketball hoops
  • Professional wooden sports flooring

Managed by Josh and George

Multiple spaces Â· Suitable for events, meetings, and activities

JG

Grade II Listed Building

Originally known as Silwood House (formerly Berry House), our building was granted Grade II listed status in 1981, recognizing its special architectural and historic interest.

Convenient Location

Located in Tulse Hill, South London, with good transport links and ample on-site parking. Easy to reach and well-connected for your convenience.

Flexible Spaces & Booking

From individual workspaces and longer-term office rentals to large event halls, find the perfect fit for your needs. Book by the hour, half-day, full day, or discuss longer arrangements.

Who We Are

The Village carries forward a powerful legacy dating back to 1699, when Thomas Tenison founded a school for girls â a radical act in a time when few believed in their education.

Rooted in the values of the Oasis charity, we believe it takes more than a classroom to raise a child â it takes a village. Our historic Grade II listed building has been thoughtfully transformed into a modern workspace while preserving its unique architectural character and historical significance.

By combining education, community development, and co-working under one roof, The Village offers a unique environment where purpose-driven work and meaningful relationships grow side by side â for the good of each other, and the good of all.

Sustainability

Location

View on Google Maps

Getting Here

Located in Tulse Hill, South London, our venue is easily accessible by public transport and car. The building is surrounded by beautiful gardens and is within walking distance of local amenities.

  • Address: 155 Tulse Hill, London SW2 3UP
  • Parking: Free on-site parking for up to 50 vehicles
  • Train: Tulse Hill Station (5 min walk)
  • Bus: Routes 2, 196, 201, 415, 432 stop nearby

Local Amenities

Our venue is surrounded by a variety of amenities to enhance your event experience.

  • Accommodation: 3 hotels within 5 minutes' walk
  • Dining: Multiple restaurants and cafÃ©s nearby
  • Shopping: Town center shops within walking distance
  • Green Spaces: Adjacent to Memorial Park
